meanings.definition: The quality of using more words than needed; wordiness.
meanings.sent1: Her verbosity made it difficult to understand her point.
meanings.sent2: The professor's verbosity in his lectures often put students to sleep.
meanings.sent3: Despite his verbosity, he still couldn't explain the concept clearly.
meanings.sent4: The verbosity of the legal document made it seem never-ending.
meanings.sent5: The verbosity of the politician's speech bored the audience to tears.

meanings.definition: Excessive wordiness in speech or writing.
meanings.sent1: The verbosity of the report made it hard to find the main points.
meanings.sent2: Her emails were full of unnecessary verbosity, making them hard to read.
meanings.sent3: The verbosity of the advertisement made it sound like a never-ending story.
meanings.sent4: The verbosity of his writing was like wading through a swamp of words.
meanings.sent5: The verbosity of the novel made it a tedious read for many.
